https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A dating method that utilizes the seasonal (summer and winter) sedimentological variations of deposits in lakes that undergo an annual freeze-up, by counting and measuring thicknesses in annual paired layers of sediments. Because each year’s sediment accumulation varies in thickness according to the climatic conditions of the melt season, any long sequence of varve measurements provides a distinctive 'signature' and can be correlated for moderate distances from lake basin to lake basin. Counting and correlation of varves have been used to measure the ages of Pleistocene glacial deposits.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from:
1) Mörner , N-A (ed.), 2014, Geochronology - Methods and Case Studies: InTech, doi:10.5772/57041
2) Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011).
